1.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said:

2.text: Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be accounted right?

3.text: Thy boastings have made men hold their peace, And thou hast mocked, with none to make thee ashamed;

4.text: And thou hast said: ‘My doctrine is pure, And I am clean in Thine eyes.’

5.text: But oh that God would speak, And open His lips against thee;

6.text: And that He would tell thee the secrets of wisdom, That sound wisdom is manifold! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.

7.text: Canst thou find out the deep things of God? Canst thou attain unto the purpose of the Almighty?

8.text: It is high as heaven; what canst thou do? Deeper than the nether-world; what canst thou know?

9.text: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, And broader than the sea.

10.text: If He pass by, and shut up, Or gather in, then who can hinder Him?

11.text: For He knoweth base men; And when He seeth iniquity, will He not then consider it?

12.text: But an empty man will get understanding, When a wild ass’s colt is born a man.

13.text: If thou set thy heart aright, And stretch out thy hands toward Him—

14.text: If iniquity be in thy hand, put it far away, And let not unrighteousness dwell in thy tents—

15.text: Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; Yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear;

16.text: For thou shalt forget thy misery; Thou shalt remember it as waters that are passed away;

17.text: And thy life shall be clearer than the noonday; Though there be darkness, it shall be as the morning.

18.text: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; Yea, thou shalt look about thee, and shalt take thy rest in safety.

19.text: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; Yea, many shall make suit unto thee.

20.text: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, And they shall have no way to flee, And their hope shall be the drooping of the soul.
